Again, that bhiká¹£u, knowing the fruits of karma, contemplates the seventh realm of the Nightæ‘© Heaven, called Vast Conduct. What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that realm?
He sees, hears, and knows, or sees with the heavenly eye:
If a person has previously known to uphold precepts with a good mind, not killing, not stealing, as previously explained, and further abandons sexual misconduct.
This refers to someone who may go to a forest near a bird with a wonderful voice.
Because that bird with a wonderful voice gives rise to lustful thoughts towards each other, it emits lustful sounds. The female bird is in front, and the male bird is behind, following each other.
The feathers on the wings of that bird have various colors, and everyone who sees them is delighted in their mind, with lustful feelings arising within.
But having seen this, he does not give rise to lustful thoughts, nor does he think about it, let alone engage in sexual activity.

Thus, that person, with pure and correct conduct, abandoning wrong desires, with pure and correct conduct, at the breaking up of the body, after death, is reborn in a good realm, in the heavenly world, in the place of Broad Practice.
Having been born there, all desires and merits are gathered, and he experiences various kinds of happiness.

There is an excellent garden and forest, with silver, lapis lazuli, and green jewel trees, great blue jewel trees, lotus-colored jewel trees, and various jewel trees adorning the garden and forest, and various jewel ponds filled with flowing water.

If a person who has previously done good karma comes here, he experiences various kinds of happiness in this forest. The forest is called the Red Forest. In that forest, there are heavenly beings and heavenly maidens.
If one enters it, the light of those trees increases and becomes even more excellent, adorned with various kinds of wonderful jewels and various kinds of clothing.
If the heavenly beings enter that forest, the light of those trees is all red in color.
The colors of those trees and forests are all like red lotus jewels or the color of kÄkaá¹­hÄnaka jewels.
The colors of the trees are soft, and nets of pearl bells cover them. The fruits appear as one wishes, and the flowing wine appears as one wishes, just as one's thoughts move.
According to the wishes of the gods, wherever they wish to enjoy, the branches and leaves of those trees will produce various wonderful sounds of enjoyment, and they move in this way.
There are many celestial maidens who, together with the heavenly multitudes and such trees, fly in the sky, going wherever they wish, no different from birds.
When those trees fly in the sky, they are all like the rising sun, universally adorning the entire sky.
Moreover, those trees are called red-colored trees, and water flows like rain in the sky, which is extremely delightful.
The sounds of those bells, the sounds of heavenly birds, and the sounds of heavenly musicâ€”such various wonderful sounds fill the sky.
At that time, the celestial beings saw the flying tree in front of them, surrounded by celestial maidens, with a single joyful mind.
There were countless hundreds of thousands of celestial maidens singing in unison, flying in the sky.
The tree was in front, like a guide, and the celestial beings followed behind, accompanying the tree.
The celestial beings were like this, thinking in their minds, giving rise to such thoughts:
'I will ascend to that tree now.'
When they had this thought, the tree turned around and the celestial beings immediately ascended.
Some played on the branches, and the celestial beings were like this, playing everywhere on the tree.

In this way, the celestial beings dwelling on the branches, when they had thoughts in their minds, lotus ponds were born on those branches, and the celestial beings and celestial maidens played and enjoyed pleasures in those ponds.
The gods who dwell in the branches of the trees in the Red Forest play and enjoy themselves with their celestial maidens, experiencing pleasures according to their thoughts.
There are also other gods who dwell in the leaves. If they have thoughts, wonderful halls will appear in the leaves.
When they have such thoughts, the halls appear, adorned with various wonderful jewels, and covered with nets of bells.
All the halls are adorned with lotus ponds and have pearl nets and curtains on their windows.
The gods, together with their celestial maidens, sing, dance, and play, without obstructing each other, and they love and care for each other.
Because of the power of the gods' good karma, they are mutually friendly, without enmity or betrayal.
Having many friends is the fruit of good karma, and having many friends is the great fruit of good karma.
At that time, the gods, with the same thoughts, play in various ways in the Red Forest.
In this Red Forest, the gods are endowed with all the pleasures they desire, due to their great virtuous karma. They can fly in the sky as they wish and experience immeasurable pleasures.
Moreover, the gods do not fly in the sky but return to their original places.
In various flowing waters that fill lotus ponds, the gods are surrounded by goddesses and play, enjoying pleasures.
Next, they go to the forest called Dense Trees.
That Dense Trees Forest is extremely delightful. In the forest there is a river with milk flowing in the river.
Such a milk river adorns the forest. If the gods drink the milk, they will remember where they were born in their past lives and how they died and came here;
where they fell from here and were reborn.
If they engage in heedless conduct, they will remember all kinds of suffering and immeasurable kinds of suffering, and their minds will become sorrowful;
because they are sorrowful, they will then abandon heedlessness;
having abandoned heedlessness, they will follow the Dharma and practice accordingly.
This great benefit is due to the power of drinking that milk-like essence.
Having drunk such powerful milk-like essence, they then enter a forest called Dense Trees.
The forest is adorned with various streams, rivers, and ponds, and there are various birds in those ponds.
There are so many birds that the tree branches are abundant with flowers, which hang down everywhere due to the weight of the flowers, serving as adornments.

There are bees made of the seven treasures, their colors all equal, drinking the nectar of the flowers and enjoying themselves, going from lotus pond to lotus pond, from the foot of one tree to the foot of another tree.
Those trees are all made of beryl, with lotus leaves made of jewels and golden-colored fruits.
Such fruits are the most delicious flavors in the heavens, surpassing even the best of suta.
Such fruits are fruits that appear in accordance with one's thoughts. If one needs flavors, such delicious fruits will appear.
Having eaten the fruit, they will sing and dance, and joyfully proceed to other places.
Next, they will go to the drinking forest. In that forest, heavenly wine flows from the trees, with a delicious flavor, fragrance, and color, which is so delightful that it cannot be fully described.
It is free from the fault of intoxication.
Such excellent wine flows from the trees like rain from clouds. Having drunk it, the gods will experience even more supreme joy.
Having thus given rise to joy, the gods will listen to various sounds, drink heavenly wine, and experience various pleasures.
Moreover, they will adorn their bodies with immeasurable light, and the goddesses will play, sing, dance, and laugh together.
Next, they will go to the lotus dragon forest.
That forest is five hundred yojanas in size, adorned with five-colored lotus flowers, and the lotuses are very fragrant.
In the lotus dragon forest, there are no other things except for lotuses and dragons.
In those lotus flowers, the dragons give rise to lustful thoughts towards each other.
Eating those lotus flowers, the dragons single-mindedly become companions for each other, surrounded by dragon maidens, in the clear water.
The water has seven merits, free from the fault of water clothes, free from the fault of mud and turbidity, free from the fault of length and shortness.
In that touch, one experiences pleasure according to one's own mind.
In this way, according to the dragons' own thoughts, in this way, the water arises according to their wishes.
When the dragons are there, playing and enjoying themselves with the dragon maidens, it is no different from the gods enjoying themselves with the celestial maidens.

At that time, the celestial beings saw the dragons playing and enjoying themselves in the lotus flower dragon forest. They descended from the sky towards the lotus flower forest, singing and making sounds, and the celestial maidens also had adorned sounds.
The dragons in the pond emitted sounds like thunder, pervading the celestial realm, like a single singing voice.
The singing of the gods in that place causes echoes in the mountains and valleys. The gods in other places come to the Lotus Dragon Forest upon hearing the singing.
Adorned with various lights, accompanied by celestial maidens, they all go to the Lotus Dragon Forest together.
At that time, the gods who were already in the Lotus Dragon Forest were playing in various ways. Other gods also came from different places such as the mountains and valleys.
When all the gods saw each other, their joy increased even more.ğŸ”½The gods and celestial maidens, as well as the dragons and dragon maidens, all played and enjoyed themselves in the water together.
The gods, celestial maidens, dragons, dragon maidens, and so forth, enjoyed themselves for a long time, playing, singing, dancing, and laughing.

The gods thus indulge in carelessness. When their good karma is exhausted and their life is about to end, if the gods and goddesses, when their merit and blessings are about to be exhausted, ascend the lotus flowers, the flowers cannot bear it;
in this way, the lotus flowers sink into the water and immediately break apart.
This is how the signs of the exhaustion of the merit of the gods should be known.

Moreover, the signs of the exhaustion of the merit of the gods and goddesses are as follows: The gods and goddesses, because of their play, ascend the backs of dragons, but the dragons cannot bear it and fall off their backs.
This is a sign of the exhaustion of the merit of the gods and goddesses. The gods who indulge in carelessness are destroyed by carelessness, and such signs appear.
At that time, if the gods were not very careless from the beginning and knew those signs beforehand, they would understand those signs and speak a verse, saying:
A long time has already passed, and now the end of life is approaching.
When death is about to arrive, the deluded gods do not realize it.
The mind is not content, attached to the pleasures of the objects of the senses,
Because the faculties are not content, the desire for objects of the senses grows.
The five faculties delight in objects, and desire to destroy the mind,
When the field of merit and karma is about to be exhausted, the deluded gods do not realize it.
This great wheel of time and karma always severs the lives of beings,
Turning swiftly, about to arrive, the deluded gods do not realize it.
This fire of death is extremely evil, blown by the wind of karma,
When the end of life is approaching, the deluded gods do not realize it.
In the conditioned state of birth and death, there are no relatives or non-relatives,
The noose of death is extremely frightening, there is no one who can escape it.
For those whose death has not yet come, whose lives have not yet ended,
All should abandon negligence, and do what benefits themselves.
The staff of death will not wait long, it will surely break the life of beings,
When great power arrives, it can destroy life.
Obscured by the blindness of objects, far from the light of the Dharma,
Therefore, one does not see or know the great and terrifying snare of death.
The deluded one cannot know, fearful at the time of death,
Because the mind is attached to objects, deceived by craving.
Retreating and retreating, one is born again, from the path one returns to the path,
Beings are destroyed by delusion, thus they experience the fruits of their own karma.
Extremely evil and extremely swift, able to destroy all worlds,
Why, at the time of death, does one not give rise to fear?
Do beings have no mind, or are they fearless,
Thus, the deluded do not know, fearful at the time of death.
like what is presently seen, no different.
Knowing this, one will not remain for long among the gods, but will decline.'

The gods, having seen the signs of decline in this way, know the signs of decline well, and their minds and thoughts are sorrowful. They do not tell other gods who have not yet declined, or gods who are about to decline.
Because those who have not yet declined, while receiving the pleasures of the five sense objects, fear that they will not believe later when they decline.
Why is this?
Because of being deluded by heedlessness in the sense objects, or because of mental confusion, one should not speak to or show the gods whose lifespans are about to end or who are heedless.
At that time, the gods, knowing this, remain silent and do not speak. They leave the lotus pond and go elsewhere.
Later, the gods again enjoy the sense objects and receive the pleasures of the sense objects.

Those who are about to fall have signs of great shame and great fear, but due to delusion they are unaware, fearless and unafraid. They play among the dragons, in the lotus flowers together with the celestial maidens. After a long time there, they experience happiness.
Again, together with such innumerable hundreds of thousands of celestial beings, they go to another mountain, that mountain is called the Mountain of Constant Joy and Garland.

Having arrived, they want to ascend. There are celestial gold, silver, celestial lapis lazuli, celestial lotus flowers, the most excellent celestial treasures, and halls with hundreds of thousands of wonderful gates adorning that mountain. There are also hundreds of thousands of excellent and wonderful lotus flowers used for adornment.

In such a mountain, the foremost and most excellent happiness is complete. There are hundreds of thousands of delightful sounds to satisfy the ears. They are mostly adorned with various celestial garments without threads, and their own bodies emit light.
They look at each other's faces, and experience happiness with wonderful colors, sounds, textures, tastes, and fragrances as they desire.
The pleasures they experience in their own minds cannot be described, and they are all accomplished.
The heavenly rivers and flowing waters, the gardens and forests are adorned, and seeing them brings joy.

The gods in this way then ascend to the mountain of Constant Joy and Garland. Having ascended the mountain, some sit on beds in the halls, some ride geese, and some gods sit cross-legged on lotus pedestals.

The gods together with the goddesses reside in the leaves of the kumbhÄ«ra tree, engaging in various amusements such as singing and dancing, and sitting to experience the bliss of the sounds of the five types of music.

If their minds wish to travel in the sky, they will go together with the goddesses to various places to observe. In those heavenly places, there is love everywhere, and they go wherever they wish, according to their desires.

Some places are like flames, with the wondrous light of gold, silver, and lotus flowers, some places have many leaves of the kuÅ›a grass with a blue-green luster, some places are the blue light of heavenly lapis lazuli, and some places are the lovely light of silver, crystal, and pearls.
Next, there is a river with sand of genuine pearls, flowing out from the peaks of jeweled mountains, with the seven kinds of merits of clear and cool water.
Seeing the water swirling in the river at those peaks, it is shaped like a genuine pearl necklace.
Having observed and seen those places in this way, flying in the sky, he further sees other places, with jeweled lotus flowers adorning the water pools, and countless bees adorning the lotus flowers.
Having seen this, he further observes other places, with gardens, forests, and pools that are extremely lovely.

He saw birds and beasts, with various colors, some silver-colored, some gold-colored, with lovely jeweled horns, lotus-treasure eyes, a back the color of true gold, white silver flanks, and crystal-colored hooves, with back legs even.
There were also other beasts, following in groups, with the wonderful colors of the seven treasures, all fearless, playing in groups, enjoying their own happiness.
Because of their karma, their bodies were exceptionally wonderful. Because of their karma, they all ate heavenly food.

Moreover, in other places in the garden forest, he saw peacocks, mynas, birds called 'without thread,' birds called 'disputatious,' birds called 'large eyes,' and birds called 'moving-winged.' Such birds roamed in groups in the mountain peaks, entering and leaving the garden forest. He saw them in the garden forest.
Having arrived at this Constant Joy Garland Mountain, about to ascend, he saw such birds.
One side of the mountain is made of blue jewels, the second side is made of lotus jewels, the third side is made of gold jewels, and the fourth side is made of silver jewels.

On the side of blue jewels there is a marvelous jewel hall called Mixed Shadows. In the hall there is a beryl tree with flowers hanging down like a large canopy, adorned with flowing streams, ponds, and lotus groves numbering in the hundreds of thousands. There are hundreds of thousands of birds of various colors, and many beautiful celestial maidens are in the hall.
On the second side, where there are lotus jewels, there is a forest called Laughter.
In that forest, the silver trees have golden leaves, and there are swarms of red bees, with the sounds of countless hundreds of thousands of birds.
There are flowing streams and rivers with fragrant water, and a gentle breeze stirs, thus pervading and adorning the forest of laughter.
On the third side, where there are gold jewels, there is a marvelous jewel forest called Joyful Jewel Forest.

There are crystal trees used as adornments. The golden branches of those trees form a net that covers everywhere. There are countless birds with hundreds of thousands of sounds. There are flowing streams and rivers used as adornments.
In that place, there are many joyful gods and goddesses who sing and dance. All the wonderful desires and merits are complete, and they are used as adornments.

In the fourth silver treasure place, there are lotus flower treasure trees with blue-colored branches used as adornments. There are many birds with various wonderful sounds. There are countless gods and goddesses. There are countless hundreds of thousands of lotus flowers used as adornments.
There are countless kinds and countless distinctions. There are countless kinds that the eyes see, and seeing brings joy.

Those forests, those trees, those rivers, that water, those jeweled branches, those lotus ponds, those birds and beasts, those lotus flowers, etc., have various colors and fragrances, and various shapes and appearances that are very dignified.
Everywhere on the mountain of Constant Joy and Garland, there are such gods and goddesses riding through the sky to that mountain of Constant Joy and Garland, everywhere on the mountain.

All see this excellent mountain of recollection with variegated light. The gods, having seen it, their eyes are delighted, all wishing to ascend the mountain, together with the goddesses, with the sounds of the five musical instruments, and the five sense pleasures and merits, to experience happiness.
Diligent in practicing good deeds, delighting in cultivating and doing much, lovable good deeds, the good treasure of keeping precepts, the fruit loved by the sages.
Thus enjoying happiness, all wishing to ascend that mountain of Constant Joy and Garland.
When about to ascend, the truthful bird speaks a verse, saying:
This river's water flows swiftly, good deeds and happiness are also like this,
The deluded do not realize, deceived by the craving for sense objects.
When such a time comes, death also comes like this,
Because of being deluded by happiness and negligence, the gods are confused and do not realize.
The ignorant are without wisdom, so they do not realize that life has passed,
And they are confused about good karma, while craving is inexhaustible.
Beings are not free from craving, and within existence, they follow their actions.
Those ignorant and craving beings do not realize what is good or bad.
The fruits of goodness are very lovable, if one experiences heavenly bliss,
Thus seeing what is bad, one is in the suffering realms of evil paths.
If one abandons good and bad, and is also able to leave behind all faults,
Then one will reach the place of non-retrogression, the place of non-birth and non-death.
That bliss attains liberation, but sensual pleasures are not liberation.
The gods of YÄma and others attain liberation due to the exhaustion of karma.
The impermanent does not abide, while the permanent is supreme.
Aspiring to the bliss within existence, falling back is not blissful.
The truthful birds, for those gods who wish to ascend the mountain, having spoken thus,
The gods, having heard this, among the assembly of gods, if there are gods who are not very indulgent, they will hear;
If they are indulgent, because of the fault of indulgence, therefore they will not hear, still attached to objects.
Those indulgent gods do not accept the words of the heavenly birds, such truthful and beneficial words.
At that time, the assembly of gods, with a joyful mind, headed towards the first mountain. On the peak of that mountain there is a hall, sitting in the hall,
As previously explained.ğŸ”½That one mountain peak is called the All-Seeing Mountain.
That All-Seeing Mountain, among a thousand mountains, is the highest and most supreme, therefore that mountain is called All-Seeing.

Together with the celestial maidens, they ascend the mountain peak, singing and dancing to various musical sounds, enjoying pleasures. Many celestial beings and celestial maidens ascend the peak and see the countless colors transformed by good karma, as well as the luminous water pools.
In those luminous pools is lovely water, pure and clear, with golden fish that delight the eyes.
The waves move chaotically, and there are flocks of geese, mandarin ducks, and ducks, with various bird sounds in the water.
Moreover, in the water there are many lotus flowers, jasmine flowers, hibiscus flowers, ninnadha flowers, and kashmari flowers, covering the pool water, with various bees making various sounds.
Furthermore, there are many mandara flowers, interspersed with many golden beads, and the water is pure and clear.
Furthermore, in that delightful pond there are also lotus flowers called bathing garlands, with a hundred thousand petals, each petal emitting countless petals.

Some lotus petals are the color of blue jewels, some lotus petals are the color of crystal, some lotus petals are the color of gold, some lotus flowers are the color of white silver, some lotus petals are the color of cat's eye stone, some lotus flowers are the color of kachidana, some diamond flowers have the most excellent fragrance.
In those petals of various colors, each has a pericarp, its color and radiance like the rising sun.

Those various pericarp have countless colors, and petals of countless colors cover the pond, namely blue, yellow, red, white, and black. The pericarp is white with red, its fragrance is delightful and fills a large pericarp.
At that time, the heavenly multitudes descend from the sky towards the pond of light, and after descending, enter the pond.
When the gods enter the pond, they sit on the backs of the golden birds. Some gods are on the platforms of the lotus flowers, playing and enjoying pleasures with many celestial maidens.

Some gods are on the kupaá¹‡á¸a-ya lotus flowers, and some other gods are in the water. Some are playing in the water on the backs of geese, and some are playing on the land with groups of celestial maidens, fully endowed with the five desires and pleasures, laughing and playing together, enjoying pleasures.

Some are playing in different places with celestial maidens in the halls, drinking celestial wine free from the fault of intoxication, fully endowed with the merits of present pleasures, taste, touch, color, and fragrance.
Among them, some gods drink wine from jeweled vessels, namely blue jewels, silver jewels, gold jewels, lapis lazuli jewels, lotus-colored jewels, and various other kinds of crystal jewels.
Some drink wine together with celestial maidens from the leaves of golden lotus flowers.

Some open leaves, without piercing or breaking the kupavarÄ flowers, drink heavenly wine, singing and dancing with joyful sounds. Some heavenly beings enjoy the food of sudhÄ, with color, touch, smell, and taste all complete.
Each one, together with their own retinue, experiences various pleasures.
Some, in other places, together with heavenly maidens, with the sounds of the five kinds of music, various singing and dancing, circle the luminous pond and play.
Some, together with heavenly maidens, play in the water.

The taste of that water changes according to the heavenly beings' thoughts. If the heavenly beings think that they want the color, smell, taste, touch, coldness, or warmth of the water to be a certain way, by the power of good karma, it will be as they think.
The fruits of good and bad karma are like this, but there is no creator.
Moreover, if those heavenly beings think like this:
'May this water become wine for me to drink.'
Immediately, by the power of thought, the wine appears, with all its qualities of touch, taste, smell, and color complete, free from the fault of intoxication.
When the gods drink it, their supreme bliss increases, and due to the power of their good karma, their minds become joyful.

However, due to the power of their own karma, the gods experience such pleasures, which are created by their own karma. All their good deeds are not lost. The master of the noose of karma, the machine of the human body, plays various tricks in the three realms, and foolish ordinary beings do not realize or understand this.
In this way, the gods are fully endowed with the five sense pleasures and experience bliss.
In that heaven, there are birds called 'truth-telling birds' that speak verses, saying:
Just as a lamp goes out when the oil is exhausted, so too is the body and life.
Because the original karma is exhausted, one will definitely fall from the heavens.
Just as when a wall is destroyed, the paintings on the wall also perish;
In the same way, when karma is exhausted, heavenly pleasures no longer exist.
The gods in their heavenly abodes, when their meritorious karma is exhausted, will fall;
All dharmas are impermanent, all beings will be destroyed.
All are impermanent and unstable, life quickly does not last long;
The power of death is very great, yet the gods do not realize it.
' The truthful bird benefits the assembly of gods, because of the power of the good karma of those gods, it is said like this.
If those gods have not been indulging for a long time, then after hearing the bird's words, they will contemplate correctly for a short time;
If they are indulging, they are also as if they have not heard, because their minds are disturbed, even if they hear, they do not accept it.

' Having thus enjoyed the pleasures of the objects for a long time in that pond, each riding their mounts, they fly through the sky towards the peak of the mountain, together with the heavenly maidens.
They see other places with innumerable mountains, of various shapes and appearances.

Among all the mountains, the Constant Joy Garland Mountain is the highest. There is another mountain called Equal Aggregate, and another mountain called Universal View. The size of these three mountains is the highest and greatest among all the mountains in the Heaven of YÄma.
The heavenly multitudes thus observe that mountain, and the light of that mountain pervades the heavenly realm.

When the heavenly multitudes see it, they immediately ascend the Constant Joy Garland Mountain. Having ascended, they see various wonderful jeweled trees interspersed, with golden trees, silver trees, and vaiá¸Å«rya trees adorning the mountain.ğŸ”½The roots, trunks, stems, joints, branches, and leaves of those trees are all adorned with the seven treasures, extremely wonderful.
The roots and trunks of those trees are adorned with the seven treasures, and the joints are arranged with different treasures.

One section is made of lapis lazuli, one section is made of lotus-colored jewels, the next section is silver, the next is gold, the next is crystal, the next is agate, and the next is kÄkaá¹‡á¸a. The tree is thus adorned differently in each section.
From the roots and trunk to the leaves, all are adorned with the seven treasures.
Not far from the tree, there is a jeweled hall, orderly and not chaotic, all of the same color, like the sunlight in the human world.
The heavenly beings, for the sake of play and enjoyment, next go to that hall.
The number of those halls is a hundred thousand, like the measure of the mind, like the practice of mental intention, like the creation of mental intention.

In that heaven, there is such a hall. Near that hall, there is a lotus pond, the number of which is also like those halls. Such lotus flowers are adorned with the seven treasures in each section, in sequence.
Moreover, in that place there are also many birds with three meritorious qualities. What are the three?
The first are water-dwellers;
the second are land-dwellers;
the third are tree-dwellers.
As for the water-dwellers, they are called mandarin ducks, nilumbuses, great cranes, geese, ducks, and peacocks, etc., these are the water-dwelling birds.

As for the land-dwellers, on the peak of that mountain there are birds that produce wonderful sounds, called the two-skilled, called the joyful sound, called all-enduring, there are birds called all-bird sounds, called always enjoying pleasure at all times, birds such as these are land-dwelling birds.
Among the heavenly sounds, the sounds of these birds are the most beautiful.

As for the birds that live in trees, they are called kinnaras, also called myna birds, peacocks, parrots, all-seeing birds, unblinking birds, all-action birds, truth-telling birds, and time-knowing birds. Such birds are tree-dwelling birds.
Among humans, half of them exist, and all of them exist in that heaven.
In that heaven, there are such innumerable birds with various sounds. In this way, in that heaven, the three kinds of birds that move about make wonderful sounds.
Moreover, on the peak of the mountain of constant pleasure and garlands, there are again birds flying in the sky, their bodies made of the seven treasures.
If those gods engage in heedless conduct, when heedlessness destroys them, those birds speak verses to admonish them, saying:
The gods destroyed by heedlessness, deceived by objects,
Their minds confused by love, the king of death is about to arrive.
Because they are attached to sensual pleasures, they do not know good or evil,
All sentient beings are deluded, deceived by the objects of desire.
They walk on various paths, create various karmas,
and are driven by various minds, transmigrating through the five realms.
' In this way, the bird sees the careless gods indulging in carelessness, and having spoken this verse to admonish them, it is like a parent disciplining their children.

However, the gods do not accept or take it to heart, and still enjoy themselves, playing, singing and dancing, until all their good karma is exhausted, and then they will fall from that heavenly realm.
Having fallen from the heavenly realm, they will fall into the hells, hungry ghosts, or animals, according to their own karmic actions.

If due to other karma, they are born among humans in a place of the same karma, they will be born in the most prosperous and joyful place, with a superior mind, always joyful, in a good country, in the land of Kananana or in the prosperous place of the country of lions, and born in a wealthy family.
Due to other karma.
The seventh ground of extensive practice is finished.
Moreover, that bhiká¹£u, knowing the results of karma, observes the places in the Heaven of YÄma.
He sees, hears, and knows:
In the Heaven of YÄma there is another place called Accomplishment.
What karma do sentient beings have that causes them to be born in that place?
He sees:

If a person has faith in the Buddha, the World-Honored One, with a good mind, observes the precepts, does not kill, does not steal, as explained before, and further abandons sexual misconduct, not recalling in mind the women with whom he has previously had sexual relations,
That good man, thus observing precepts, with a well-intentioned mind, at the end of life, will be reborn in the good destinies, in the Heaven of YÄma, in the realm of accomplishment.
Having been born there, he will obtain the fruits of his own karma.

Namely, in a garden, forest, lotus pond, with various birds singing beautifully, various adornments, and surrounded by heavenly maidens with wonderful bodies, he will be born in such a heavenly blissful place, with the sounds of the five kinds of music, various amusements, incomparable supreme sounds, touches, tastes, forms, and smells, and will experience bliss.
It is like a pond with five streams, all of which are water, flowing into the pond from the sides, unobstructed.
In the same way, the five sense faculties are attached to the five kinds of love, and the body of the five kinds of love always follows the five sense objects, never knowing enough.
It is like five places all filled with fire, all ablaze, with the wind blowing, spreading everywhere.
If dry firewood is added to the five fires in this way, those fires will blaze and grow.
